head.p: to:joan.letterman@gmail.com from: jane.smith@web.de RE: Racism in the USA

p.s: as you may know I read The Hate U Give in class and after reading of these experiences I wondered if racism in the USA was really as horrible as the author had written.
To get that information I did some research and stumbled upon this germanGerman news article from ana rather known germanGerman news company called Zeit (online).
In the article it is said that the racism is even noticable in statistics.
At first the article makes an example through the death of Michael Brown, an 18 year old African American man who was shot by the police in Ferguson.
It is explained that through events like these the racism becomes noticable even though offically racism was banned 50 years ago with the Civil Rights Act.
Apparently this discrimination already starts in aspects like school, where the percentage of black people succeeding and graduating is smaller than the percentage of white people.
Most of them also leave the schooling system after graduating high school.
What also stood out to me was that more black people arare likely to have no work than the amount of white people in the USA.
It says that more than a fourth of black people are living in poverty while it is not even a tenth of white people.
After reading this article I was very mad to see that so many people are being discriminated through a system that is still going.
To get another point of view I wanted to ask you to tell me about your experiences regarding this topic.
I'll be waiting for your response.
